page.title: 14THE TYNE VALLEY RAILWAY cont
page.content: {THE BICENTENARY 1981 saw the celebrations of George Stephenson's bicentenary. There was a display of locomotives on the Jubilee Field including the 'Puffing Billy' one of Stephenson's locomotives. A fancy dress parade was included and many stalls, tents and displays were held. Â£2800 was raised and the money was distributed among various village groups. { {150TH anniversary of the {Blaydon-Hexham line } In March 1985 the last steam train to be built, Evening Star, travelled along the line to mark the 150th anniversary of the Blaydon-Hexham line and it is hoped that more celebrations will take place in the local villages to mark the 150th anniversary of the Newcastle-Carlisle line in 1989.
